name: viralrecon-viral-genomes
title: Viral Genome Assembly and Analysis
description: Assembles and analyzes viral genomes from amplicon or metagenomic sequencing data. Supports Illumina and Nanopore platforms with comprehensive variant calling, consensus generation, and lineage analysis. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2`
content:
Viralrecon - Viral Genome Assembly and Analysis

Comprehensive bioinformatics pipeline for viral genome reconstruction from both amplicon-based and metagenomic sequencing data. Optimized for SARS-CoV-2 but applicable to any viral genome, supporting both Illumina and Nanopore sequencing platforms.

What is Viralrecon?

Viralrecon provides end-to-end viral genome analysis from raw sequencing data to annotated consensus genomes with variant calling, enabling viral surveillance, outbreak tracking, and molecular epidemiology studies.

Key Features

  • Dual Platform Support: Illumina and Nanopore
  • Multiple Protocols: Amplicon and metagenomic methods
  • Comprehensive Variant Calling: Multiple callers for accuracy
  • Consensus Generation: High-quality genome assembly
  • Lineage Assignment: Clade and variant classification
  • Low-Frequency Variants: Detect minority variants

Pipeline Workflow - Illumina

  1. Read Preprocessing: Quality control and adapter trimming
  2. Host Removal: Optional host read depletion
  3. Read Mapping: Align to viral reference genome
  4. Variant Calling: Multiple tools for robust detection
  5. Consensus Assembly: Generate consensus sequences
  6. Annotation: Functional effect prediction
  7. Lineage Analysis: Clade assignment and phylogenetics
  8. Quality Control: Comprehensive MultiQC reporting

Pipeline Workflow - Nanopore

  1. Sequencing QC: Assess run quality metrics
  2. Read Aggregation: Combine reads from multiple files
  3. Alignment: Map long reads to reference
  4. Variant Calling: Long-read specific callers
  5. Consensus Generation: Assemble high-quality genome
  6. Downstream Analysis: Annotation and lineage

Scientific Applications

  • Viral Surveillance: Monitor circulating viral strains
  • Outbreak Investigation: Track transmission chains
  • Variant Detection: Identify emerging mutations
  • Molecular Epidemiology: Study viral evolution
  • Clinical Diagnostics: Characterize patient infections

Advantages

  • Platform Flexible: Works with multiple sequencing technologies
  • Protocol Agnostic: Handles various library prep methods
  • Robust Variant Calling: Multiple tools for consensus
  • Comprehensive QC: Extensive quality metrics
  • Regular Updates: Maintained for emerging variants

Input Requirements

  • FASTQ Files: Illumina or Nanopore sequencing reads
  • Sample Sheet: CSV with sample information
  • Reference Genome: Viral genome FASTA
  • Optional: Host genome for depletion

Main Outputs

  • Consensus Genomes: High-quality assembled sequences
  • Variant Calls: VCF files with all mutations
  • Lineage Assignment: Clade and variant classifications
  • Coverage Plots: Genome-wide sequencing depth
  • QC Reports: Comprehensive quality metrics
  • Phylogenetic Data: For downstream analysis

Perfect for: Viral Genomics • COVID-19 • Outbreak Investigation • Viral Surveillance • Molecular Epidemiology
